intro: Rondeletia intermixta subsp. intermixta, commonly known as the red-flowered rondeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
